thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: 2-4A

title: 2-4A
text:
Posted: October 17, 2015 at 1:51 a.m. 
LONOKE 26, HEL.-W. HELENA CENTRAL 16 
HELENA-WEST HELENA — Lonoke scored 26 consecutive points after falling behind 8-0 early and the Jackrabbits spoiled homecoming for the Cougars of Helena-West Helena Central in a 2-4A game Friday night. 
Helena-West Helena Central (3-4, 2-2) started fast, putting together a 4-play, 65-yard scoring drive that took up 1:16, ending on a 1-yard run by K.K. Harvey. The Cougars faked the extra-point attempt and holder Jordan Watson slipped a shovel pass to Aswad Allen to put Helena-West Helena up 8-0. 
The Cougars then embarked on an 18-play drive from their 25 to the Lonoke 15, where the drive stalled and Helena-West Helena turned the ball over on downs. Then, Lonoke (3-4, 1-3) got going. 
The Jackrabbits had a third-and-12 situation from their 13 when quarterback Savant Rountree hit Justin Meadows for an 87-yard score with 10:47 remaining in the second quarter. The try for two failed and Helena-West Helena led 8-6. 
Lonoke stopped the Cougars, and Xavier Hodge put the Jackrabbits in front to stay with 5:36 to go in the first half with a 3-yard scoring run. Meadows ran in the two-point conversion to put Lonoke up 14-8, which was the halftime score. 
Lonoke’s Kameron Cole intercepted an errant Cougars pass with 3:44 to go in the third quarter. Hodge scored six plays later to cap off a 47-yard drive with 10:31 to go in the game. The try for two failed and it was 20-8. 
Hodge scooped up a Cougars fumble with 5:24 to play and returned it 62 yards for the score to push the lead to 26-8 after the failed two-point conversion. 
Helena-West Helena’s Malik Arnett scored on a 13-yard run with 2:08 left to cap off a 6-play, 62-yard drive. Arnett threw to Kameron Davis for the two-point conversion to make the score 26-16. 
CENTRAL ARK. CHRISTIAN 42, SOUTHSIDE BATESVILLE 12 
Central Arkansas Christian (6-1, 4-0 2-4A) scored all its points in the first half and defeated Southside Batesville (4-3, 1-3). 
Braylon Harris scored three touchdowns in the first quarter for the Mustangs and Grant Wood added another to give CAC a 28-0 lead at the end of the first quarter. CAC quarterback Noah Evans threw a 68-yard touchdown pass to Josh Johnson with 10:55 left in the second quarter to put CAC up 35-0. 
Hunter Corbell scored on a fumble recovery to give the Mustangs a 42-0 lead. 
HEBER SPRINGS 33, NEWPORT 20 
NEWPORT — Quarterback Hunter Chandler rushed for two touchdowns and passed for another to lead Heber Springs (3-4, 2-2 2-4A) over Newport (1-6, 1-3). Receiver Anderw Engle caught 8 passes for 131 yards and rushed for a touchdown and Pierce Mitchum returned a punt 50 yards for the game’s first score. 
Chandler completed 17 passes in 28 attempts for 309 yards. Senior running back Edgar Torres added 108 yards on 17 carries. 
STUTTGART 42, RIVERVIEW 26 
STUTTGART — Michael Smith threw two touchdown passes and Kirk Hughes rushed for two more as Stuttgart (5-2, 4-0 2-4A) posted a victory over Riverview (3-4, 1-3). 
Zyrique Geans returned an interception 99 yards for another Stuttgart touchdown. Smith started the scoring on a 55-yard touchdown pass to Darius Earvine in the first quarter. Hughes scored on two 3-yard runs in the second quarter, which also featured Smith’s second touchdown pass, a 15-yard completion to Keondrae Davis. Je’Rel Dabner scored on a 1-yard run before Geans’ interception return finished the Ricebirds’ scoring in the fourth. 
(Advertisement)
